alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 13 at 1:55AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM AKDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Falls Creek near counties around Falls Creek. * WHEN...Until 815 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 AM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain is moving away from the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing, especially near Falls Creek. Up to 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.50 inches are possible. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 6:00pm the stage was 21.92 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet. Impacts: At 24.0 feet: Water levels will be at the bridge abutment of 9 mile bridge along Mitkof Highway.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
